title: Devendra Jhajharia:From Losing His Left Hand In An Accident To Winning 2 Paralympic Gold Medals

From Losing His Left Hand In An Accident To Winning 2 Paralympic Gold Medals - Devendra Jhajharia Has Taken Life Head On

From Losing His Left Hand In An Accident To Winning 2 Paralympic Gold Medals - Devendra Jhajharia Has Taken Life Head On

When Devendra Jhajharia was 8 years old, he accidentally touched an electric wire causing himself a lot of damage. As a result his left hand had to be amputated. End of the road in athletics right? Wrong!

Devendra did not give up. In 2002, he won gold at the 8th FESPIC Games javelin throw. His mastery to throw it despite lacking one arm proved he was at a different level altogether.

AFP

In 2004, Devendra won gold at the Paralympics. But it would not be the first time that he achieved this feat. He did it again in 2016 with another gold to his name. 12 years apart, not bad for a guy who lost an arm as a kid.

In between these two golds, Devendra won a gold at the 2013 worlds and again a silver in 2015. There was also a silver in the 2014 Asian Para Games.

Don't Miss

Athletes like him make us proud because they had to work extra hard to get to the top. He has faced mockery from others as a kid and fought hard to make it this far. This is a big ask for an able-bodied athlete, let alone a physically challenged one.

Devendra is an inspiration to many para-athletes and a lesson for us to never give up on one's dreams. If he can do it despite losing one arm as a kid, what's your excuse?
